intro: Blitum tenue, commonly known as slender blitum, is a low-growing annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant features slender, prostrate stems covered with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically appearing in clusters along the stems. Blitum tenue is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
